title: Simplifying Denominators Containing Two terms
text: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.
speech: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.
pacedSpeech: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.

title: Simplifying Denominators Containing Two terms
text: The denominator is $$2+\sqrt{23}$$. So multiply the fraction by $$\frac{2-\sqrt{23}}{2-\sqrt{23}}$$.
speech: The denominator is  2 plus the square root of 23 . So multiply the fraction by  fraction, 2 minus the square root of 23 over, 2 minus the square root of 23  .
pacedSpeech: The denominator is   2 plus the square root of 23
. So multiply the fraction by   fraction, 2 minus the square root of 23 over, 2 minus the square root of 23

title: The Distributive Property
text: Use the distributive property to simplify: $$\frac{\frac{\sqrt{12x}}{2+\sqrt{23}} \left(2-\sqrt{23}\right)}{2-\sqrt{23}}=\frac{3\sqrt{x}-\sqrt{3x}}{2}$$
speech: Use the distributive property to simplify:  fraction, fraction, the square root of 12 x end root over, 2 plus the square root of 23  times parentheses, 2 minus the square root of 23 , over, 2 minus the square root of 23  is equal to fraction, 3 the square root of x minus, the square root of 3 x end root over 2,
pacedSpeech: Use the distributive property to simplify:  this expression
